title: Drawing, 1938-88-1194
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. The arch rises from two barges. Corinthian columns support the entablature. Above stands a pedestal upon steps. Statues stand at the corners of teh lowest one. On top is a group. The complicated plan of the basin is incompletely shown. Rostral columns stand at its corners which are flanking the arch. Houses at the square surrounding the basin and of a street are shown in the background.
